subject: Investing
title: Availability Bias and Vivid Headlines
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Availability Bias and Vivid Headlines.

hook.text: After a plane crash, airline stocks dropâ€”even though flying is statistically safer than driving.

buildup.text: Availability bias makes you overweight information that's vivid, recent, or emotionally charged.

discovery.text: A dramatic market crash on TV feels more likely to repeat than boring statistical data suggests.

twist.text: Media amplifies rare events. The slow, steady climb of markets doesn't make for exciting news.

climax.text: Base investment decisions on data and probabilities, not on whatever headline grabbed you this morning.

punchline.text: What's easy to remember isn't always what's likely to happen.
